Definition: A clinical trial or similar research study. Reference: list of FDA data elements describing a research study: prsinfo.clinicaltrials.gov/definitions.html

Short: Elements that belong to all information items.
Definition: Elements that belong to all information items.

Short: A human language, spoken or written.
Definition: A human language, spoken or written.

Short: A set of rules under which this content was created
Definition: A set of rules under which this content was created

Short: A human-readable narrative, potentially including images, that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human.
Definition: A human-readable narrative, potentially including images, that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human.

Short: A state that relates to the workflow or interpretation of this resource. Certain status values can modify the meaning of the resource, for example, entered-in-error. When a boolean value is used, Status of true indicates the record is active, false means inactive.
Definition: A state that relates to the workflow or interpretation of this resource. Certain status values can modify the meaning of the resource, for example, entered-in-error. When a boolean value is used, Status of true indicates the record is active, false means inactive.

Short: Business identifier or external id for this resource.
Definition: Business identifier or external id for this resource.

Short: The larger entity that the asserted item is a portion of. For example, an organization part of a larger organization, or an encounter with a hospitalist might be part of a larger hospitalization encounter.
Definition: The larger entity that the asserted item is a portion of. For example, an organization part of a larger organization, or an encounter with a hospitalist might be part of a larger hospitalization encounter.

Short: A distinguishing word or group of words naming an item.
Definition: A distinguishing word or group of words naming an item.

Short: Description of the intent or use of the item.
Definition: Description of the intent or use of the item.

Short: The stage in the progression of a therapy from initial experimental use in humans in clinical trials to post-market evaluation.
Definition: The stage in the progression of a therapy from initial experimental use in humans in clinical trials to post-market evaluation.

Short: The general type or class of this item.
Definition: The general type or class of this item.

Short: The person or entity that the information in this resource relates to, if different than the person of record. The subject of information can be a reference or a code, the latter when the subject is described generically, for example, in terms of a relationship to the subject of record (e.g., wife).
Definition: The person or entity that the information in this resource relates to, if different than the person of record. The subject of information can be a reference or a code, the latter when the subject is described generically, for example, in terms of a relationship to the subject of record (e.g., wife).

Short: The condition that is the focus of the study. For example, In a study to examine risk factors for Lupus, might have as an inclusion criterion 'healthy volunteer', but the target condition code would be a Lupus SNOMED code.
Definition: The condition that is the focus of the study. For example, In a study to examine risk factors for Lupus, might have as an inclusion criterion 'healthy volunteer', but the target condition code would be a Lupus SNOMED code.

Short: Describes an individual and how to reach them.
Definition: Describes an individual and how to reach them.

Short: Items such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references, that provide background for the current item.
Definition: Items such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references, that provide background for the current item.

Short: Key terms to aid in searching for or filtering the study.
Definition: Key terms to aid in searching for or filtering the study.

Short: The country, state or other region taking legal responsibility.
Definition: The country, state or other region taking legal responsibility.

Short: A description of the purpose of the item.
Definition: A description of the purpose of the item.

Short: Description of the group or groups enrolled or qualified to be enrolled in the study.
Definition: Description of the group or groups enrolled or qualified to be enrolled in the study.

Short: The date and time span for which something is active, valid, or in force.
Definition: The date and time span for which something is active, valid, or in force.

Short: The organization responsible for the execution of the study.
Definition: The organization responsible for the execution of the study.

Short: Indicates the individual who has primary oversite of the execution of the study.
Definition: Indicates the individual who has primary oversite of the execution of the study.

Short: Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry. Could be a clinical site, community site, or a mobile facility.
Definition: Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry. Could be a clinical site, community site, or a mobile facility.

Short: A code explaining unplanned or premature termination of a plan of treatment, course of medication, or research study.
Definition: A code explaining unplanned or premature termination of a plan of treatment, course of medication, or research study.

Short: An added or follow-up note, often after the fact, that contains metadata about who made the statement and when.
Definition: An added or follow-up note, often after the fact, that contains metadata about who made the statement and when.

Short: Arm refers to pre-specified group or subgroup of participant(s) in a clinical trial assigned to receive specific intervention(s) (or no intervention) according to a protocol.
Definition: Arm refers to pre-specified group or subgroup of participant(s) in a clinical trial assigned to receive specific intervention(s) (or no intervention) according to a protocol.

Short: A goal that the study is aiming to achieve in terms of a scientific question to be answered by the analysis of data collected during the study.
Definition: A goal that the study is aiming to achieve in terms of a scientific question to be answered by the analysis of data collected during the study.
